subject: JUnit4Adapter and expected exception
msgSnippet: Hello! I try to run a Junit 4 test case with Maven 2. Maven 2 does not support Junit 4, so I added the following method to my test case: public static
messageBody:
Hello!

I try to run a Junit 4 test case with Maven 2. Maven 2 does not
support Junit 4, so I added the following method to my test case:

public static junit.framework.Test suite() {
return new JUnit4TestAdapter(MyTest.class);
}

Now, Maven can run that test case.

But there is a problem: I defined a test method that expects an exception:

@Test(expected = IllegalArgumentException.class)
public void testNullArgument() {
new SomeClass(null);
}

If I run that test in Eclipse 3.2 (has support for Junit 4), I will
get green lights.

But Maven fails:

Test set: MyTest
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tests run: 9, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.023
sec <<< FAILURE!
MyTest.testNullArgument() Time elapsed: 0.001 sec <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Given arg must not be null.
at org.apache.commons.lang.Validate.notNull(Validate.java:201)
at SomeClass.<init>(SomeClass.java:51)
at MyTest.testNullArgument(MyTest.java:27)


Finally, my question: does the JUnit4TestAdapter support expected
exceptions?

Regards, Martin Burger
